name: v0.4.5
body: #110  `fetch` should now print an error message if the GitHub release doesn't exist

name: v0.4.4
body: #103: Fetch now supports outputting the contents of a release asset to standard output so it can be piped to another program.

name: v0.4.3
body: #102 Fixes issues with downloading release assets with names containing regex characters

name: v0.4.2
body: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/95: Update the build to publish Darwin / ARM 64 binaries that work with the new ARM-based Macs.

name: v0.4.1
body: #92: Fixed the usage help text for `--ref`.

name: v0.4.0
body: #90: Added a proper logger to `fetch`. It defaults to `INFO`, but the desired verbosity can be specified with `--log-level`. Fixes #89 and #30.

name: v0.3.14
body: #87: Previously added `--ref` feature broke `--branch` due to conditional ordering

name: v0.3.13
body: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/85: `fetch` should now properly handle pagination for tags, so you'll be able to fetch older tags from repos that have many tags.

name: v0.3.12
body:
#81: Delete circleci nightly job
#79: `fetch` now supports a flexible `--ref` in addition to `--commit`, `--branch`, or `--tag`

name: v0.3.11
body:
https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/66: `fetch` will now log the file count after extraction.
https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/77: `fetch` will now skip Git tags that don't follow SemVer. This allows you to use it with repos that use both SemVer and non-SemVer tags.

Special thanks to @pete0emerson for the contributions!

name: v0.3.10
body: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/70 : fetch now uses go modules instead of `dep` to manage dependencies.

name: v0.3.9
body:
https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/62: This rolls back the change from `v0.3.6`. This means that you can now pass empty values again to `--branch`, `--tag`, and `--commit`, as long as one of those is non-empty, and `fetch` will handle it correctly. 

Special thanks to @vedala for the fix!

name: v0.3.8
body:
https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/61: You can now specify an optional `--progress` flag to have `fetch` show progress during downloads. This is especially useful for large downloads.

Special thanks to @ohlsont for the PR!

name: v0.3.7
body: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/56: Fix the `--source-path` argument to only download the exact paths/files specified.

name: v0.3.6
body:
#31: When fetch is called with `--branch`, `--tag`, `--commit`, a valid error message is now given.

Special thanks to @vedala for the fix!

name: v0.3.5
body: #52: Fixed #48. GitHub Enterprise users can now successfully download binaries.

name: v0.3.4
body: #51 Publish checksums along with binaries.

name: v0.3.3
body:
https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/50

Release assets can now be identified using regex. If multiple assets match the regex, `fetch` will automatically download all of them. You can also now pass in multiple checksums, only allowing the download if the computed checksum matches any of the provided ones.

Special thanks to @coryvirok for the contribution!

name: v0.3.2
body: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/44: Update dependencies from `github.com/codegangsta/cli` to its new name, `gopkg.in/urfave/cli.v1`. There should be no change in behavior.

name: v0.3.1
body: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/36: Fetch should now work with two-digit versions (`vX.Y`).

name: v0.3.0
body: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/43: `fetch` should now work with GitHub Enterprise URLs! If the repo URL you specify is not GitHub.com, `fetch` will automatically assume it's GitHub Enterprise and use the proper API calls. This defaults to GitHub Enterprise version `v3`, but that can be overridden with the new `--github-api-version` option.

name: v0.2.0
body:
#34: Fetch now supports verifying the checksum of a release asset using SHA256 or SHA512. 

Unfortunately, this release also constitutes a breaking change in that `--release-asset` may no longer be passed multiple times.

name: v0.1.1
body: - https://github.com/gruntwork-io/fetch/pull/23: `fetch` will now exit with a proper error message if you specify an unsatisfiable tag constraint.

name: v0.1.0
body: - We've updated our CI build job to use Go 1.7.3. Before, we were using Go 1.6.x, which apparently [does not work with the latest version of OS X](https://golang.org/doc/go1.7#ports).

name: v0.0.10
body: - `fetch` now supports tags that don't follow the standard SemVer pattern (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH), although you cannot use the tag constraint operators (e.g. ~, >, <) with it.

name: v0.0.9
body: - Fix how version number is handled in fetch

name: v0.0.8
body: - Switch to module-ci for build & test

name: v0.0.7
body: - Change build environment to try to get working binaries

name: v0.0.6
body: - Add support back in for reading source paths from command-line args for backwards compatibility

name: v0.0.5
body:
- Added support to fetch for downloading not only the source code from a GitHub repo, but also binary assets uploaded to a GitHub release. Downloading such assets is easy for public repos (just `curl` or `wget` the public URL), but for private repos, it's a confusing process that requires multiple API calls. Now, with fetch, it's a one-liner: just use the `--release-asset` option to specify which assets to download.
- This means that instead of reading in the source files to download as an (optional) argument, fetch now uses the `--source-path` argument, which you can specify more than once.
- Added support for reading the GitHub token as the environment variable `GITHUB_OAUTH_TOKEN`. This is more secure than passing it as a command line option.

name: v0.0.4
body: - Fix panic when downloading from a repo that has no tags

name: v0.0.3
body:
- fetch can now download files from a specific git commit or a git branch. When a branch is specified, fetch downloads the latest commit on a branch.
- Fixed a bug where empty values for `--tag` were not handled properly for repos whose tag names started with `v`.
- Enables fetch to pull from a specific git commit or branch
- Updated README.md.

name: v0.0.2
body:
- Fixes #2. 
- Refined command-line output.

name: v0.0.1
body: Initial release!
